intro: Pseudoreoxis, commonly known as the false oxalis, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Oxalidaceae. These plants are characterized by their heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, often yellow or white flowers. They are native to various regions in South America and are adapted to a range of environmental conditions. Pseudoreoxis species typically grow in moist, shaded environments and are often found in forest understories. Their botanical features make them popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and unique foliage.
